subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Any way to speed up the scanning on the 12-469?-A couple more questions
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
--_a155ac11-258f-467d-9a1e-011400bf1ca1_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


What about copying it from one of the chips?
 
 Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.comFrom: w9sz@...: Thu, 3 Jan 2008 22:57:07 -0600Sub=
ject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Any way to speed up the scanning on the 12-469?-A c=
ouple more questions




The chip is a microcontroller. It needs a program =
called "firmware" put into it before it will do anything useful. The chips =
have a program memory which comes blank when you buy them.The "code" is the=
 representation of what is called machine language that tells the various p=
arts of the microcontroller what to do. In this case, I imagine it increase=
s a voltage with a certain pattern and then drops it down to zero, starting=
 over again and repeating at a certain rate. This would produce a repetitiv=
e sweep of the radio at a certain rate when the microcontroller is hooked u=
p to the radio correctly.It wouldn't be difficult for me to write my own pr=
ogram to do this with a PIC microcontroller, but if someone else has alread=
y done it, why bother?If I can't get my hands on the machine code, I'll wri=
te some myself.ZackOn Fri, 4 Jan 2008, mllejade wrote:> Frank, please let m=
e know if you should, for whatever reason, decide> to sell that chip (to co=
ntrol the scan rate of the '469). I'd like> to purchase it from you, if pos=
sible.>> Thanks,>> Sharon>> P.S. I've read the follow-ups to my initial que=
stion and being a> layman at modifying electric apparatuses, what do you al=
l mean by> code? Does one need the code and the chip in order to speed up t=
he> scanning on a hacked '469; or can one do it with simply a code, or> the=
 chip, alone?>>> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <franks-box=
es@...>> wrote:>>>>>> Yeah, the guy that first made the hack was giving awa=
y a chip to> control the scan rate. I don't know if it's still available. I=
 have> one of the chips, and no '469.>>>> Frank-S>>>>>> To: EVP-ITC@...: le=
ongbabe@...: Thu, 3 Jan 2008 16:37:00> +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Any way to s=
peed up the scanning on the 12-> 469?>>>>>>>>>> I'm still relatively new to=
 building boxes and would like to know> if it's possible to speed up the sc=
anning a bit on a hacked RS 12-> 469. Thanks,Sharon --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com, Frank Sumption> <franks-boxes@> wrote:>> > Thanks for listening. Y=
eah, that's the> problem with noise reduction methods, they tend to take ou=
t voices. I> think if I used the muffled sound consistently they would talk=
> through it though, the goal being to get higher level voices, and> audio.=
 The clarifier is just a low pass filter that can be adjusted--> just an id=
ea.> I have some female guides that speak sometimes, and> there's the seven=
 sisters that come though sometimes, but I don't> know much about that. > >=
 Frank-S> > > To: EVP-ITC@: debbie@: Wed, 2> Jan 2008 10:33:33 -0700Subject=
: Re: [EVP-ITC] The '470 mod?> > > > >> Frank, Thanks for the extra instruc=
tions, it doesn't sound too> difficult for me so I'll give it a shot. > > B=
y the way, I did listen> to your tone control clip. Since I'm new to this m=
y comments are> probably not "worth" much at this point. I thought the enti=
re clip> itself was a lot smoother and clearer than most I've heard so far>=
 from various sources (the mixed station sounds are in smaller pieces> so f=
or someone like me it would be easier to pick out the EVPs as> opposed to e=
ntire words from radio announcers). The short piece about> 2/3 of the way t=
hrough, where I'm guessing you used a clarifier,> sounded muffled to me, wh=
ich makes me think it would also muffle the> EVPs. Definitely easier on the=
 ears but for someone inexperienced> (and I seem to be the only one here!) =
it seems it would be harder to> pick out the real words too.> > By the way,=
 in listening to the> deluge of clips uploaded last night, I can't help but=
 notice that the> voices are all men. Just curious -- is that always the ca=
se?> > > > >>>>>>> _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _> > Debbie Tejada> > "Once you can accept=
> the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something,> wearing=
 stripes with plaid comes easy. " ~Albert Einstein> > On Jan> 2, 2008, at 1=
0:22 AM, Frank Sumption wrote:> > > > > > I have> the '470, but I don't kno=
w if it's the older one or not. I was able> to modify it, but it was somewh=
at different than in the video> instruction, there was more than one green =
wire. You have to lift the> top board so you can see the wire connections o=
n the other board,> they are labeled, and you can tell what wire to cut/uns=
older. (mute> wire). Frank-S> > Share life as it happens with the new Windo=
ws Live.> Share now! > > > > > > > > >> ___________________________________=
_______________________> Get the> power of Windows + Web with the new Windo=
ws Live.>> http://www.windowslive.com?> ocid=3DTXT_TAGHM_Wave2_powerofwindo=
ws_122007>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> __________________________________________________=
________>> Get the power of Windows + Web with the new Windows Live.>> http=

<BR>The chip is a microcontroller. It needs a program called "firmware" put=
 <BR>into it before it will do anything useful. The chips have a program <B=
R>memory which comes blank when you buy them.<BR><BR>The "code" is the repr=
esentation of what is called machine language <BR>that tells the various pa=
rts of the microcontroller what to do. In this <BR>case, I imagine it incre=
ases a voltage with a certain pattern and then <BR>drops it down to zero, s=
tarting over again and repeating at a certain <BR>rate. This would produce =
a repetitive sweep of the radio at a certain rate <BR>when the microcontrol=
ler is hooked up to the radio correctly.<BR><BR>It wouldn't be difficult fo=
r me to write my own program to do this with a <BR>PIC microcontroller, but=
 if someone else has already done it, why bother?<BR><BR>If I can't get my =
hands on the machine code, I'll write some myself.<BR><BR>Zack<BR><BR>On Fr=
i, 4 Jan 2008, mllejade wrote:<BR><BR>> Frank, please let me know if you=
 should, for whatever reason, decide<BR>> to sell that chip (to control =
the scan rate of the '469). I'd like<BR>> to purchase it from you, if po=
ssible.<BR>><BR>> Thanks,<BR>><BR>> Sharon<BR>><BR>> P.S.=
 I've read the follow-ups to my initial question and being a<BR>> layman=

oes one need the code and the chip in order to speed up the<BR>> scannin=
g on a hacked '469; or can one do it with simply a code, or<BR>> the chi=
p, alone?<BR>><BR>><BR>> --- In <A href=3D"mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogro=

it's possible to speed up the scanning a bit on a hacked RS 12-<BR>> 469=
. Thanks,Sharon --- In <A href=3D"mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com">EVP-ITC@y=

wrote:>> > Thanks for listening. Yeah, that's the<BR>> problem =
with noise reduction methods, they tend to take out voices. I<BR>> think=
 if I used the muffled sound consistently they would talk<BR>> through i=
t though, the goal being to get higher level voices, and<BR>> audio. The=
 clarifier is just a low pass filter that can be adjusted--<BR>> just an=
 idea.> I have some female guides that speak sometimes, and<BR>> ther=
e's the seven sisters that come though sometimes, but I don't<BR>> know =
much about that. > > Frank-S> > > To: EVP-ITC@: debbie@: Wed=
, 2<BR>> Jan 2008 10:33:33 -0700Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The '470 mod?>=
 > > > ><BR>> Frank, Thanks for the extra instructions, it d=
oesn't sound too<BR>> difficult for me so I'll give it a shot. > >=
 By the way, I did listen<BR>> to your tone control clip. Since I'm new =
to this my comments are<BR>> probably not "worth" much at this point. I =
thought the entire clip<BR>> itself was a lot smoother and clearer than =
most I've heard so far<BR>> from various sources (the mixed station soun=
ds are in smaller pieces<BR>> so for someone like me it would be easier =
to pick out the EVPs as<BR>> opposed to entire words from radio announce=
rs). The short piece about<BR>> 2/3 of the way through, where I'm guessi=
ng you used a clarifier,<BR>> sounded muffled to me, which makes me thin=
k it would also muffle the<BR>> EVPs. Definitely easier on the ears but =
for someone inexperienced<BR>> (and I seem to be the only one here!) it =
seems it would be harder to<BR>> pick out the real words too.> > B=
y the way, in listening to the<BR>> deluge of clips uploaded last night,=
 I can't help but notice that the<BR>> voices are all men. Just curious =
-- is that always the case?> > > > ><BR>>>>>>=
